item.title: ðŸŽ¶Losing Focus: Some Thoughts on the State of Music Streaming
item.description: When Steve Jobs first announced the iPhone in 2007, the reception was far from glowing. Compared to cell phones of the time, the iPhone made a lot of confusing design decisions. Keyboard loyalists decried the lack of physical buttons, and the extra features like email or internet were seen as wasteful or pointless. Who would really want to carry a computer in their pocket? I don’t think anyone is asking this in 2025.
